intro: Thrixspermum anjunganense, commonly known as the Anjugan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are covered in fine, hair-like structures, a feature typical of the genus Thrixspermum. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
